forecast-period.text: An intense low pressure system centred east of Tasmania will move southeast across the Tasman Sea during Saturday. A high pressure system will also move eastwards across the Bight, passing Tasmania on Saturday night and early Sunday. A low pressure trough is then expected to approach western Bass Strait early next week.
Details of warnings are available on the Bureau's website www.bom.gov.au, by telephone 1300-659-217* or through some TV and radio broadcasts.
* Calls to 1300 numbers cost around 27.5c incl. GST, higher from mobiles or public phones.

Cloudy with isolated showers over southern and mountain areas, tending scattered about the central coast during the morning. The chance of a brief shower extending to the northern plains in the afternoon, though remaining dry and mostly sunny in the northwest. Cool to mild with moderate south to southwesterly winds, fresher near the Gippsland coast.

Isolated showers over Gippsland. Fine and partly cloudy over remaining southern areas, apart from isolated coastal showers or drizzle early in the morning. Mostly sunny in the north. Cool to mild light to moderate east to southeasterly winds.
Fine apart from isolated morning showers about the Gippsland coast. Mild to warm and partly cloudy with light to moderate easterly winds.
Fine apart from clearing showers in East Gippsland. Mild to warm and partly cloudy with light to moderate northerly winds and afternoon coastal seabreezes.
